item.title: Litter - around shrubs, 12th January
item.description:
Litter needs removing from around and within large shrubs on the grass strip between main carriageway and the access slip to houses.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickhurst Lane, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement uneven at the dropped kerb for pedestrian's crossing, 12th January
item.description:
The pavement is uneven at the kerb here and tonight while walking home down the hill pushing my daughter's buggy in the dark, the buggy wheel got stuck and the whole buggy started to tip forward where my daughter and myself both nearly face planted down the hill. It was a very close call and rather dangerous. There are two nurseries up the top of this hill so multiple people would be pushing buggies along this road each day. It needs to be urgently fixed please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree near corner, 12th January
item.description:
The tree outside 82-84 Cazenove Road N166AB, the tree by the corner on Cazenove Road is growing into the windows. Please can it be cut through out the winter, thanks
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cazenove Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Rubbish dumped on street, 12th January
item.description:
Rubbish is dumped and accumulating around the rubbish bins and not being collected. The issue was reported multiple times and marked as resolved even though the rubbish was not collected. There are cardboard boxes, furniture, wooden crates and various rubbish bags piling up around the bins

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 204, Union Street, Southwark, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: Water leaking out of pavement, 12th January
item.description:
On Christchurch Street, outside the main entrance of the church, there is a crack in the pavement. Water is pouring out of it and has been all day, maybe longer.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Christchurch Street, Chelsea, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Domestic Fly Tipping Woolwich Road SE10, 12th January
item.description:
This domestic dumping outside this location at this busy location is getting out of hand and has been reported several times previously. Highly likely to becoming from the addresses above the shops at this location so you would have thought it would not be too difficult to identify the culprits. Come on RBoG, you keep telling us how you're going to get tough on fly tipping. There is also the issue of the shops keeping their commercial bins out the front of their shops 24-7. They are unsightly and obsure the crossing point.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woolwich Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 5 Street lights broken in the alley, 12th January
item.description:
5 Street lights are broken in the alley between Portland Way and Roland Street, which runs behind Michael Faraday school and alongside Missenden. This is leading to poor and unsafe lighting conditions.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roland Way, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged footpath and crossover, 12th January
item.description:
Local builders is completing works and is currently destroying the footpath. Dangerous for pedestrians needs to have temporary repairs and then made good following completion of building works. Opposite to this site is also another footpath that was poorly repaired following the install of the garden room visible from the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Berens Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London

item.title: Between corner of Lady Margaret rd. and no 2 Dunollie road, 12th January
item.description:
Site of proposed Cycle Hangar ie south side of Dunollie road This area of road and gutter line is in a very poor state , eroded and needing resurfacing surely before the proposed bicycle hangar is installed, as work afterwards to the whole stretch of road would be impossible ..... see photos enclosed
